com.articulate.nlp

Class RelExtract

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.articulate.nlp.RelExtract

  • public class RelExtract
extends java.lang.Object
    2015-2017 Articulate Software 2017- Infosys Author: Adam Pease apease@articulatesoftware.com This program is free software; you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation; either version 2 of the License, or (at your option) any later version. This program is distributed in the hope that it will be useful, but WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY; without even the implied warranty of MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE. See the GNU General Public License for more details. You should have received a copy of the GNU General Public License along with this program ; if not, write to the Free Software Foundation, Inc., 59 Temple Place, Suite 330, Boston, MA 02111-1307 USA Extract relation expressions based on SUMO relation &%format expressions. Process sentences through the relation extraction rules.

      • formatWordsOnly

        public static CNF formatWordsOnly(CNF cnfinput,
                                  java.lang.String format)
        Retain only the literals involving tokens in the dependency parse that also are from the original format string. Literals involving tokens that are arguments and not from the format string will have a non-empty type (which means a CoreLabel.category()).

                              java.lang.String formatString)
        Return a verion of the CNF input where words found in the formatString are turned into word variables like "part*" that requires the word but not its token number to match, and makes all other constants in the CNF into variables.

      • addTypes

        public static CNF addTypes(CNF cnfInput)

      • processOneRelation

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,CNF> processOneRelation(Formula form,
                                                                         KB kb,
                                                                         Interpreter interp)
        Process one SUMO format statement to create a dependency parse pattern that can match free text. Use language generation to create a sentence from the format statement, then run dependency parsing, then modify the dependency parse to keep just the essential parts of the pattern and add SUMO type restrictions. Words appearing in the format statement become word variables (word*), words that are the arguments to the relation become free variables (?word) that have an associated sumo type

      • addRHS

        public static java.lang.String addRHS(java.lang.String rel,
                                      CNF lhs)
        if there is a null in one of the parameters of the returned relation statements,, prefix the result with a ';' character

      • generateOneRelationPattern

        public static void generateOneRelationPattern(Formula f,
                                              KB kb,
                                              Interpreter interp)
        Process all the format statements in SUMO to create dependency parse templates that match them. Each relation should have a single augmented dependency parse pattern that results.

      • generateRelationPatterns

        public static void generateRelationPatterns()
        Process all the format statements in SUMO to create dependency parse templates that match them. Each relation should have a single augmented dependency parse pattern that results.

      • processAndSearch

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,CNF> processAndSearch()
        Process all the format statements in SUMO to create dependency parse templates that match them. Each relation should have a single augmented dependency parse pattern that results. Then search over a corpus for matches.

      • toCNFLabels

        public static java.lang.String toCNFLabels(CNF cnf)
        show the full CoreLabels in each Literal of the CNF
